fields.prompt: 21. ​  If a number is increased by 50% of its value and the result is then decreased by 50% of this new value, what will be the percent change from the original number to the final result?
explanations: An increase of 50% results in a number that is \(\frac{3}{2}\) of the original number. A 50% decrease results in a number of half the value. A 50% increase followed by a 50% decrease results in a number whose value is \(\frac{3}{4}\) of the original number, since \(\frac{3}{2}\times\frac{1}{2}=\frac{3}{4}\). That represents a decrease of \(\frac{1}{4}\), or 25%.

You may have taken \(n-1\) instead of \(n+1\) to be a factor of \(n^2-2n-3\).
You may have solved the equation \(3n\left(n-2\right)=0\) instead of \(3n\left(n-2\right)=9\).

The given statement can be written as \(3n\left(n-2\right)=9\). Both sides can be divided by 3, and the expression on the left can be rewritten to get \(n^2-2n=3\). This is turn can be written as \(n^2-2n-3=0\) an solved as a quadratic equation. After factoring, this can be written as \(\left(n-3\right)\left(n+1\right)=0\). So, the possible values for n are the solutions of \(n-3=0\) and \(n-1=0\). One of those solutions is 3.

fields.prompt: 25.  In the xy-coordinate plane, what is the slope of a line that is perpendicular to the line with equation \(2x+3y=6\)?

topics.secondary: properties of parallel and perpendicular lines

explanations: You may have taken the slope of a perpendicular line to be the reciprocal of a given slope, but it is the negative of the reciprocal.
You identified the slope of a parallel line, rather than a perpendicular one, but the slope of a perpendicular line is the negative of the reciprocal of the given slope.

You may have taken the slope of a line with an equation of the given form to be based on a ratio involving the y-coefficient and the constant, but the slope is the negative of the ratio of the x-coefficient to the y-coefficient
You may have taken the slope of a perpendicular line to be the negative of a given slope, but it is the negative of the reciprocal.

The slope of a line with an equation of the given form is the negative of the ratio of the x-coefficient to the y-coefficient. So, the slope of the line is \(-\frac{2}{3}\). The slope of a perpendicular line is the negative of the reciprocal of the given slope. So, any perpendicular line has a slope of \(\frac{3}{2}\).
